emerging_technologies.name: AI-driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Contracts that adapt to changing conditions in real-time using AI, ensuring compliance and efficiency.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces legal disputes, increases trust in digital agreements, but raises concerns about AI bias.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, trust in AI, and the evolution of blockchain technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: DAOs manage and operate space missions, from satellite maintenance to mining operations, using tokenized incentives.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for broader space access, but also introduces new forms of geopolitical competition.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological feasibility, international cooperation, and space law development.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Memory Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Marketplaces where individuals can sell or lease their memories or cognitive experiences.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical concerns about privacy, consent, and the commercialization of personal experiences.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Privacy laws, ethical guidelines, and technological maturity of neural interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Energy is traded in real-time via tokens, enabling peer-to-peer energy exchange with transparent pricing.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Encourages renewable energy adoption, but could lead to market volatility and energy inequality.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory frameworks, technological infrastructure, and consumer trust in digital currencies.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain-verified Autonomous Decisions
mainstream_technologies.description: Autonomous systems make decisions that are transparently logged on the blockchain for verification.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in logistics, finance, and public services for transparency and trust.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Grid Management
mainstream_technologies.description: Energy grids managed by a decentralized network, reducing inefficiencies and enhancing resilience.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in developed nations, with emerging markets following suit.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards decentralized systems in governance, energy, and beyond, enhancing autonomy and resilience.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes individual empowerment but challenges traditional centralized structures.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on privacy, security, and democratization of services.

epoch_themes.description: The establishment of economic systems beyond Earth, leveraging space resources and new market dynamics.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Opens new economic frontiers but also necessitates new legal and ethical frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growth in space tech startups, international collaboration, and space law development.
